subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Yoga: From Spiritual Practice to Studio Class
description: A short lesson to help you apply Yoga: From Spiritual Practice to Studio Class.

hook.text: In the West, yoga means stretching. In India, it means union with God. How did a spiritual discipline become a workout?

buildup.text: Patanjali's Yoga Sutras (200 BCE) outline eight limbs of yoga. Physical postures are just one. Meditation is the goal.

discovery.text: Classical yoga is about stilling the mind to experience pure consciousness. The body is a tool, not the focus.

twist.text: Modern yoga studios stripped the spirituality and kept the poses. A $80 billion industry sells flexibility, not nirvana.

climax.text: Yoga's journey from cave to studio shows how the West consumes Eastern wisdom: selectively, commercially, superficially.

punchline.text: Yoga meant union with God. The West made it a workout. Context was lost.

quiz.question: What is the original purpose of yoga?
options: Stilling the mind to experience union with the divine
